June 2016 Newsletter
See the winners of the 2016 BigCommerce Design Awards!
In April, we launched the inaugural BigCommerce Design Awards to find the best of the best in BigCommerce site design and ingenuity. After 6,000 social votes and an intensive review by our panel of judges, we’ve finalized our winners, who will receive a cash prize and be featured in the September 2016 edition of Inc Magazine.
See the Winners <[[https://www.bigcommerce.com/blog/best-ecommerce-website-design/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner]]> Great seeing you in Chicago at IRCE We were thrilled to interact with so many partners and merchants during the 2016 International Retailer Conference + Exhibition this month in Chicago. From our CEO’s speech “Curation + Comedy + Connection = Word of Mouth That Moves the Needle” to encounters on the trade show floor to our one-day “Best Practices in Ecommerce” workshop, we were able to trade advice, handshakes and laughs with many of you.
If you didn’t make it to this year’s event, make it a priority for 2017! Coming Soon — On-Demand Training We know that design and solutions partners like you are self-motivated learners. That’s why we’re creating an on-demand training program that will enable you to expand your BigCommerce design or marketing skills whenever the inspiration strikes.
Courses include BigCommerce Foundations, Sales 101 & 102, Technology 101 & 102, a Stencil deep dive and more.
Be on the lookout for more details, coming soon. BigCommerce Channel Manager for Social Platform Integration You may have already noticed a new menu in the side navigation of the BigCommerce Control panel — the BigCommerce Channel Manager <[[https://www.bigcommerce.com/blog/introducing-channel-manager/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=introducing-channel-manager]]>. The Channel Manager is a new addition to our platform designed to help merchants grow sales while making multi-channel selling easier than ever:
- Add a Shop section to merchants’ Facebook pages and implement Pinterest Buyable Pins.
- Reach more customers with native integrations and catalog syncing with Facebook, Pinterest and leading marketplaces (coming soon).
- Remove barriers and unify channels with built-in bulk export and inventory syncing.
Read More <[[https://www.bigcommerce.com/blog/introducing-channel-manager/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=introducing-channel-manager]]> New to the Partner Portal: All the Stencil info you need in one place When we introduced Stencil, our new approach to theme and front-end development, no one was more excited than our design and solutions partners. Now we’ve made it easier for you to access answers to common questions you might have as a developer / designer, directly from your partner portal:
- Technology Overview – a rich introduction
- Installation and Launch instructions
- Development Quick Start tutorial
- Handlebars overview
- Upcoming Releases
- Support
Take Me There <[[https://partners.bigcommerce.com/English/Solutions/resources/stencil.aspx?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=partner-portal]]> New Study: How to Find Success in Omni-Channel Sales
Ecommerce leaders like you know that consumer behavior has changed drastically over the last few years, with more people engaging in a combination of online and brick-and-mortar research and buying. But until now, it’s been difficult to find data on where, when and how consumers were using each sales channel or how merchants could best focus their resources when creating an omni-channel strategy for their brand.
To help partners and merchants better understand what makes a seamless and successful omni-channel experience, we conducted a survey in partnership with Kelton Global <[[http://keltonglobal.com/]]> of more than 1,000 nationally representative Americans 18 years and older who cited making an online purchase within the previous six months.
The results illuminate answers to omni-channel questions like:
- Who shops online
- Where Americans spend online
- When Americans spend online
- What Americans are buying
- What influences the American shopper to purchase
- How Americans feel about online shopping
- How important is online shopping
- What this means for U.S. retailers
We think this data will prove highly valuable as you help your merchants build successful brands and omni-channel experiences.
Read the Full Results <[[https://www.bigcommerce.com/blog/omni-channel-retail/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=omni-channel-retail]]>
Other product updates, new apps, and promotions
Join the BigCommerce Community
Last month, we announced our new and improved Community <[[http://forum.bigcommerce.com/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=forum]]>, designed to make it easier for merchants and partners to find all the answers, resources and connections needed to help businesses grow. This also offers a great opportunity for partners like you to interact directly with merchants to provide your own BigCommerce design expertise and guidance. Interact and offer services and support to merchants like never before. To get started, register and complete your profile, then start a discussion. Get Started Now <[[http://forum.bigcommerce.com/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=forum]]> Request for public comment: Proposed Cart API Schema As a valued partner, you can play a key role in the future of our platform. We are under way creating a public Cart API and we'd like your feedback. Last week, we posted an open request for comment on GitHub of our proposed Cart API schema, which considers use cases such as:
- Retrieving an abandoned cart
- Reconstructing a cart from a URL
- Supporting multiple shipping destinations for a single cart quote
What would you like the new Cart API to do? Share youre thoughts on our GitHub discussion.
Go to GitHub <[[https://github.com/bigcommerce/api?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=github]]>
Beta testing: New optimized single-page checkout
Over 18% of all carts are abandoned due to complicated checkout flows. That’s we’re introducing the most streamlined checkout in the industry, incorporating the industry’s best practices to give your merchants the best conversion rates possible. Customers will zoom through an intuitive checkout with a reduced number of steps, address autofill, credit card type detection, optional fields, and an optimized guest checkout experience.
To nominate your client stores for this beta, please fill out the application form.
Read More <[[http://grow.bigcommerce.com/beta-test-unified-checkout.html?utm_medium=email&utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=newsletter&utm_term=&utm_content=unified-checkout]]>
